abstract: ABSTRACT Nonparametric Bayesian models provide a framework for flexi ble probabilistic modelling of complex datasets. Unfortunately, the high-dimensional averages re- quired for Bayesian methods can be slow, especially with the unbounded repre- sentations used by nonparametric models. We address the challenge of scaling Bayesian inference to the increasingly large datasets found in real-world appli- cations. We focus on parallelisation of inference in the Ind ian Buffet Process (IBP), which allows data points to have an unbounded number of sparse latent features. Our novel MCMC sampler divides a large data set between multiple processors and uses message passing to compute the global likelihoods and pos- teriors. This algorithm, the first parallel inference schem e for IBP-based models, scales to datasets orders of magnitude larger than have previously been possible.
title: Large Scale Nonparametric Bayesian Inference: Data Parallelisation in the Indian Buffet Process
